ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ“œ A VOICE FROM THE DESERT The Great Isaiah Scroll (~125 BCE), the oldest nearly complete book of the Hebrew Bible, is on display in full for the first time since 1968 at the Israel Museum. Discovered in 1947 near Qumran, the 7-meter Dead Sea Scroll is now shown in a climate-controlled case as part of the museumâ€™s 60th anniversary. President Isaac Herzog called it a symbol of Jewish continuity. ğŸ“† Exhibit runs through June 6. ğŸ“Œ Source: Times of Israel
